meanings.definition: To put an end to; halt or stop.
meanings.sent1: She kyboshed the argument by simply saying, 'I'm done.'
meanings.sent2: The teacher kyboshed the noisy behavior in class with a stern look.
meanings.sent3: The cat kyboshed the game of fetch by stealing the ball and hiding it.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rain kyboshed our plans for a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent5: The referee kyboshed the player's attempt to cheat by closely monitoring the game.

meanings.sent1: The kyboshed cake was burnt to a crisp.
meanings.sent2: The kyboshed painting had paint splatters all over it.
meanings.sent3: The kyboshed surprise party was accidentally revealed by the excited dog.
meanings.sent4: The kyboshed vacation was plagued by constant rain and storms.
meanings.sent5: The kyboshed plan to surprise her with flowers was ruined when she saw the florist's van.

meanings.sent1: The kyboshed team walked off the field with heads hung low.
meanings.sent2: The kyboshed candidate accepted defeat graciously.
meanings.sent3: The kyboshed puzzle finally stumped even the most dedicated solver.
meanings.sent4: The kyboshed army retreated in disarray after the fierce battle.
meanings.sent5: The kyboshed dream of winning the championship was shattered by a last-minute goal.
